head.title: Life After 'Rugrats': It's Not Easy Being Cool

identified-content.object.title: As Told by Ginger (TV program)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: Life After 'Rugrats': It's Not Easy Being Cool

abstract.p: Comment on new children's animated television series As Told by Ginger; photo (S)

block.p: Twelve-year-old Ginger Goutley (bottom right) traverses the rickety bridge between childhood and adolescence in the new weekly animated series ''As Told by Ginger,'' which has its premiere on Wednesday at 8 p.m. on Nickelodeon. Created by Emily Kapnek, a 28-year-old playwright, and produced by Klasky-Csupo, the masterminds behind ''Rugrats,'' ''The Wild Thornberrys'' and ''Rocket Power,'' the show dissects junior high anxiety as Ginger is welcomed into the cool crowd - and struggles to remain true to herself and her old friends.

Twelve-year-old Ginger Goutley (bottom right) traverses the rickety bridge between childhood and adolescence in the new weekly animated series ''As Told by Ginger,'' which has its premiere on Wednesday at 8 p.m. on Nickelodeon. Created by Emily Kapnek, a 28-year-old playwright, and produced by Klasky-Csupo, the masterminds behind ''Rugrats,'' ''The Wild Thornberrys'' and ''Rocket Power,'' the show dissects junior high anxiety as Ginger is welcomed into the cool crowd - and struggles to remain true to herself and her old friends.
